thread.title: Watch Jonathan Papelbon go after teammate Bryce Harper
thread.title_full: Watch Jonathan Papelbon go after teammate Bryce Harper - MarketWatch

author: Silvia Ascarelli
title: Watch Jonathan Papelbon go after teammate Bryce Harper
text:
When baseball players get into a fight, it’s usually with someone on the other team.
On Sunday, Washington Nationals closer Jonathan Papelbon took it out on star outfielder Bryce Harper.
Harper flied out in the eighth inning when Nationals were tied 4-4 with the Philadelphia Phillies. As he returned to the dugout, an angry-looking Papelbon started talking to him, Harper eventually responded and Papelbon reached for Harper’s throat with one hand and shoved him toward the dugout wall. Teammates pulled them apart.
Papelbon, who was called in to pitch at the top of the eighth inning, gave up a home run in the ninth. Harper was pulled for the ninth inning. The Nationals lost the game 12-5.
It’s been a frustrating year for the Nationals, who had been picked by some to win the National League East. Instead, they were mathematically eliminated from any playoff spot this weekend.
